channel.title: CVE Feed for IBM -- Aspera Faspex
channel.description: The latest CVEs for IBM -- Aspera Faspex

item.title: CVE-2023-24965|2024-09-26T14:32:14.442Z -- ibm -- aspera%20faspex
item.description: IBM Aspera Faspex 5.0.5 does not restrict or incorrectly restricts access to a resource from an unauthorized actor. IBM X-Force ID: 246713.

item.title: CVE-2023-30995|2024-09-26T14:38:33.682Z -- ibm -- aspera%20faspex
item.description: IBM Aspera Faspex 4.0 through 4.4.2 and 5.0 through 5.0.5 could allow a malicious actor to bypass IP whitelist restrictions using a specially crafted HTTP request. IBM X-Force ID: 254268.

item.title: CVE-2022-22409|2024-09-26T14:41:23.222Z -- ibm -- aspera%20faspex
item.description: IBM Aspera Faspex 5.0.5 could allow a remote attacker to gather sensitive information about the web application, caused by an insecure configuration. IBM X-Force ID: 222592.

item.title: CVE-2022-22405|2024-09-26T14:23:00.364Z -- ibm -- aspera%20faspex
item.description: IBM Aspera Faspex 5.0.5 could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by the failure to properly enable HTTP Strict Transport Security. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain sensitive information using man in the middle techniques. IBM X-Force ID: 222576.

item.title: CVE-2023-37396|2024-09-20T19:49:01.215Z -- ibm -- aspera%20faspex
item.description: IBM Aspera Faspex 5.0.0 through 5.0.7 could allow a local user to obtain sensitive information due to improper encryption of certain data. IBM X-Force ID: 259671.

item.title: CVE-2023-37396|2024-09-20T17:31:33.094Z -- ibm -- aspera%20faspex
item.description: IBM Aspera Faspex 5.0.0 through 5.0.7 could allow a local user to obtain sensitive information due to improper encryption of certain data. IBM X-Force ID: 259671.

item.title: CVE-2022-40745|2024-08-03T12:28:42.305Z -- ibm -- aspera%20faspex
item.description: IBM Aspera Faspex 5.0.0 through 5.0.7 could allow a local user to obtain sensitive information due to weaker than expected security. IBM X-Force ID: 236452.

item.title: CVE-2023-27279|2024-08-02T12:09:41.845Z -- ibm -- aspera%20faspex
item.description: IBM Aspera Faspex 5.0.0 through 5.0.7 could allow a user to cause a denial of service due to missing API rate limiting. IBM X-Force ID: 248533.

item.title: CVE-2023-22869|2024-08-02T10:20:31.134Z -- ibm -- aspera%20faspex
item.description: IBM Aspera Faspex 5.0.0 through 5.0.7 stores potentially sensitive information in log files that could be read by a local user. IBM X-Force ID: 244119.

item.title: CVE-2023-37411|2024-06-28T20:09:16.406Z -- ibm -- aspera%20faspex
item.description: IBM Aspera Faspex 5.0.0 through 5.0.6 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 260139.

item.title: CVE-2023-37411|2024-05-28T12:06:05.023Z -- ibm -- aspera%20faspex
item.description: IBM Aspera Faspex 5.0.0 through 5.0.6 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 260139.

item.title: CVE-2023-37396|2024-06-04T17:24:36.284Z -- ibm -- aspera%20faspex
item.description: IBM Aspera Faspex 5.0.0 through 5.0.7 could allow a local user to obtain sensitive information due to improper encryption of certain data. IBM X-Force ID: 259671.

item.title: CVE-2023-37400|2024-06-04T17:24:36.694Z -- ibm -- aspera%20faspex
item.description: IBM Aspera Faspex 5.0.0 through 5.0.7 could allow a local user to escalate their privileges due to insecure credential storage. IBM X-Force ID: 259677.

item.title: CVE-2023-37397|2024-06-04T17:24:39.600Z -- ibm -- aspera%20faspex
item.description: IBM Aspera Faspex 5.0.0 through 5.0.7 could allow a local user to obtain or modify sensitive information due to improper encryption of certain data. IBM X-Force ID: 259672.

item.title: CVE-2023-27279|2024-06-04T17:24:46.228Z -- ibm -- aspera%20faspex
item.description: IBM Aspera Faspex 5.0.0 through 5.0.7 could allow a user to cause a denial of service due to missing API rate limiting. IBM X-Force ID: 248533.

item.description: IBM Aspera Faspex 5.0.0 through 5.0.7 stores potentially sensitive information in log files that could be read by a local user. IBM X-Force ID: 244119.

item.description: IBM Aspera Faspex 5.0.0 through 5.0.7 could allow a local user to obtain or modify sensitive information due to improper encryption of certain data. IBM X-Force ID: 259672.

item.title: CVE-2023-37411|2024-08-02T17:16:29.498Z -- ibm -- aspera%20faspex
item.description: IBM Aspera Faspex 5.0.0 through 5.0.6 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 260139.

item.description: IBM Aspera Faspex 5.0.0 through 5.0.7 could allow a local user to escalate their privileges due to insecure credential storage. IBM X-Force ID: 259677.

item.title: CVE-2024-45096|2024-09-05T15:47:08.719Z -- ibm -- aspera%20faspex
item.description: IBM Aspera Faspex 5.0.0 through 5.0.9 could allow a user with access to the package to obtain sensitive information through a directory listing.

item.title: CVE-2024-45097|2024-09-05T15:46:21.130Z -- ibm -- aspera%20faspex
item.description: IBM Aspera Faspex 5.0.0 through 5.0.9 could allow a user to bypass intended access restrictions and conduct resource modification.

item.description: IBM Aspera Faspex 5.0.0 through 5.0.9 could allow a user to bypass intended access restrictions and conduct resource modification.
